DataElement.preferredName: Biopsy Tissue Specimen Future Use Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify if consent has been granted to obtain biopsy tissue specimens for future use.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biopsy Tissue Specimen Future Use Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose._Permission to do something._The watery fluid in the mouth made by the salivary glands.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: A time that is yet to come.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A time that is yet to come.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to store and use his/her sample(s) for use in future health research.
